events.1685: Gerard George Clifford, Dutch director of East India Company, was born.
events.1761: Third Battle of Panipat: Ahmed Shah Abdali, the ruler of Afghanistan, defeats the Marathas; Maratha imperialism checked.
events.1831: Heinrich Von Stephan, famous general of postal union and freedom fighter, was born at Pomerania.
events.1858: The hearing of the case began that was filed against the last Mughal Emperor Bahadhur Shah II for taking part in the first armed revolution against the British.
events.1859: The Bahadur Shah II case trial was started, which ended on March 29.
events.1885: Madhav Narayan Joshi, comedy drama writer, was born.
events.1900: Raghukul Tilak, educationist and social worker, was born at Meerut, UP.
events.1928: Vijay Tendulkar, famous playwright and novelist, was born.
events.1956: Vinoo Mankad scores 231 vs New Zealand, 413 opening stand with Roy.
events.1987: Kapil Dev takes his 300th Test wicket. At 28, he was the youngest cricketer to accomplish this feat.
events.1988: Mrs. Janaki Ramachandran sworn in as CM of Tamil Nadu.
events.1990: President returns the Indian Post Office (Amendment) Bills of 1986 to Parliament at the instance of the Government.
events.1993: The union govt. acquires 67.703 acres of land in and around the disputed area at Ayodhya and refers the issue to the Supreme Court.
events.1994: Malhotra Committee recommends privatisation and foreign participation of LIC and GIC.
events.1997: Jaspal Rana bags six gold medals in the men's standard pistol and air pistol and set two more records on the penultimate day of the National shooting.
